question_text: 다음 중 한국어에서 '개' (gae)는 무엇을 세는 단위인가요?
Which of the following sentences uses the appropriate honorific form and correct word order?
The verb stem '바꾸다' (to change) is modified into which form to express a future action?
What is the most appropriate way to politely ask someone to wait in Korean?
What is the correct use of the '기 때문에' (because) structure?
option_a: 그 사람이 늦었기 때문에, 우리는 일찍 시작했어요.
option_b: 그 사람이 늦어서, 우리는 일찍 시작했어요.
option_c: 그 사람이 늦을 거예요 기 때문에, 우리는 일찍 시작했어요.
option_d: 그 사람이 늦기 때문에, 우리는 일찍 시작했어요.

question_text: Which of the following sentences contains a grammatical mistake?
Which sentence correctly uses the honorific form of 'to go' (가다) for a superior?
Which sentence correctly uses the conditional form '면'?
Which sentence uses the correct particle to modify a noun in Korean?
Which sentence correctly uses the particles '에서' and '까지' to express a range?
Which sentence correctly uses the polite request form '주세요'?
Which sentence means 'I have never been to Korea'?
Which sentence correctly uses the passive form of '보다' (to see)?
Which sentence expresses 'Even if it rains, I will go' using the conditional '아/어도'?
option_b: 비가 오기도 하니까, 저는 갈 거예요.

question_text: Which sentence correctly uses a conjunction to express contrast?
option_a: 그 사람은 친절하지만, 나는 그를 좋아하지 않아요.
option_b: 그 사람은 친절해서, 나는 그를 좋아하지 않아요.
option_c: 그 사람은 친절하고, 나는 그를 좋아하지 않아요.
option_d: 그 사람은 친절하지만, 나는 그를 좋아하지 않습니다.

question_text: What does the suffix '-고 나서' mean?
Which sentence correctly expresses 'I should go to bed early'?
Which sentence correctly uses '는 것' to express 'I like reading books'?
option_d: 나는 책을 읽고 있는 것을 좋아해요.

question_text: Which sentence uses '게 되다' to express 'I came to like it'?
Which sentence uses the correct form of '가다' (to go) to express 'I will go to the store'?
